# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

# Solution

Here is a possible implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")

    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)

    return col
end
```

This function first lowercases the entire column name. Then it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. Finally, it removes any leading or trailing whitespace characters from the column name using the `strip` function. 

For example:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("Column-Name")
"column_name"

julia> clean_column("  Leading and Trailing Spaces  ")
"leading_and_trailing_spaces"
```
